Method Detail

dataset

public ReadQuery<T> dataset(Dataset theDataset)
Description copied from interface: Query
Specify the dataset this query will be executed against. This defines the active graph for the query and will override anything specified within the query. Use Datasets.NO_DATASET

Specified by:
dataset in interface Query<T>
Specified by:
dataset in interface ReadQuery<T>
Overrides:
dataset in class AbstractQuery<T>
Parameters:
theDataset - the active graph dataset
Returns:
this query
See Also:
Datasets, ImmutableDataset

limit

public ReadQuery<T> limit(long theLimit)
Description copied from interface: ReadQuery
Set the maximum number of results that can be returned by this query. Setting the limit on the query will override any limit specified in the original query string, however, setting the limit to ReadQuery.NO_LIMIT will not remove the limit if it is specified in the query, but you can use it to remove a limit that has already been set if there was not a limit specified in the query originally.

Specified by:
limit in interface ReadQuery<T>
Parameters:
theLimit - the new limit
Returns:
this query

offset

public ReadQuery<T> offset(long theOffset)
Description copied from interface: ReadQuery
Set the offset of the query results. Similar to ReadQuery.limit(long) this will override an offset in the query, and you can use ReadQuery.NO_OFFSET to remove an offset specified on the query, but not in the query string.

Specified by:
offset in interface ReadQuery<T>
Parameters:
theOffset - the offset
Returns:
this query

toString

public String toString()
Returns the original query.

Specified by:
toString in interface Query<T>
Overrides:
toString in class AbstractQuery<T>
